relation: There is a restaurant at the Wolfson Campus that's called Off the grill the food there is really good.
I didnt stay in the dorms
I would say that the academic rigor is about average, but varies significantly from professor to professor.
Make sure to ask a lot of questions because for some reason there really isn't any department or person that guides you through the enrollment and registration process after you are accepted

Miami Dade College is affordable. It provides an average but improving learning experience. It's a good place for freshman student to start because most of its faculty members are very helpful and supportive( atleast at the campus I attended which was Wolfson Campus.)
pageTitle: Miami Dade College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {524788=I love Miami Dade College. The staff as well as most of the professors are helpful and want to see you succeed. The school has even gotten recognized by President Obama in 2011 at a graduation ceremony. I found that to be very remarkable!, 207934=Miami Dade College has helped me a lot and I have only attended for one semester. I have learned and improved immensely in mathematics. I first scored into a remedial math class and Im currently about to start MAT1033. Their math lab is the best, the people there are always willing to go the extra mile to help you succeed., 969027=Miami Dade has it's usual clubs, SGA and cultural clubs, etc. In addition to those, in Spring 2012 Homestead Campus added a Journalism Club to the list. The Journalism Club writes articles for the local South Dade News Leader and is very interested in getting it's members published. It's a great club., 199780=Ok, college isn't cheap. People thinkn that Dade is cheap; however, it is reasonable for 4 classes at about 1200 (not books included). Sure other schools are charging a fortune for a class, but it is enough to at least get started and save up for other terms and transfering schools., 1081007=I have been a student with Miami Dade College since 1997. It has been a rough road but they haven't given up on me and I them. To say this unbiased they are a 8 out of 10.}

textAfterTable: Kristen from Miami, FL 06/02/2009 Reviewer is A past student here. 17 out of 25 people found this review useful. 5 people found this inaccurate. 2 of 511 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Lazy & looking to catch a break for two years? Well then, Miami Dade is just the place for you! It's also great for anyone currently working a full-time job. And also, for anyone that is continuing there education after a long hiatus. If you have school spirit and are interested in participating in school events then this is NOT the school for you. Tips for prospective students Apply for the honors college! I wish I would have known it existed before hand. The students in the honors program receive full tuition including books. They get extreme VIP treatment. It is obviously more enduring than the regular classes, but so much more worth it. If you're not honors college material then just sit back & relax because this school is just a two-year extension of high school. Did enjoy being here
